lead_paragraph: Syrian rebels, aided by Turkish tanks, planes and special forces, said they had taken control of Jarabulus, the last major Islamic State redoubt near Turkey’s border.

byline.contributor: Tim Arango and Ceylan Yeginsu reported from Istanbul, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Maher Samaan from Paris, and Eric Schmitt and Michael D. Shear from Washington.
byline.original: By TIM ARANGO, ANNE BARNARD and CEYLAN YEGINSU

headline.print_headline: Turkey Assists as Syria Rebels Advance on ISIS
headline.main: Turkey’s Military Plunges Into Syria, Enabling Rebels to Capture ISIS Stronghold

snippet: Syrian rebels, aided by Turkish tanks, planes and special forces, said they had taken control of Jarabulus, the last major Islamic State redoubt near Turkey’s border....
abstract: Turkey dispatches tanks, war planes and special operations forces across border into northern Syria, largest military investment country has made so far in Syrian conflict; move leads to Syrian rebels taking over Islamic State stronghold in Jarabulus within hours, with assistance of American airstrikes; move also rolls back advances made by Syrian Kurdish militias.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
